results.title: Jordan Valley
results.brief_description: This film aims at giving some impression of Palestine and its people, and at throwing light on some of the ideas and sayings made familiar to many through bible readings.

results.title: Jordan Peele's fake news PSA with Barack Obama
results.brief_description: Jordan Peele turned his humour and filmmaking skills to creating a deepfake video of Barack Obama to draw attention to the dangers of the technology.

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

results.title_for_label: Jordan Peele’s fake news PSA with Barack Obama
results.description: In a sobering example of the potential for ‘deepfake’ technology to create alternate realities beyond the cinematic sphere, in 2018, BuzzFeed and director Jordan Peele (Get Out, Us) voiced a cautionary PSA in which former U.S. president Barack Obama appears to offer contentious opinions on the history of the Black Panthers and President Trump. Peele’s production company created the clip using a combination of old and new technology: Adobe After Effects and the AI face-swapping tool, FakeApp. Peele’s intention was to draw attention to the capacity for AI to generate photorealistic fake videos that could be mis-used to spread disinformation. The clip ends by urging viewers to critically assess what they see on the internet and to ‘rely on trusted news sources’ to avert the potential dystopia that awaits us in a post-truth era of fake news.
description_for_label: In a sobering example of the potential for ‘deepfake’ technology to create alternate realities beyond the cinematic sphere, in 2018, BuzzFeed and director Jordan Peele (Get Out, Us) voiced a cautionary PSA in which former U.S. president Barack Obama appears to offer contentious opinions on the history of the Black Panthers and President Trump. Peele’s production company created the clip using a combination of old and new technology: Adobe After Effects and the AI face-swapping tool, FakeApp. Peele’s intention was to draw attention to the capacity for AI to generate photorealistic fake videos that could be mis-used to spread disinformation. The clip ends by urging viewers to critically assess what they see on the internet and to ‘rely on trusted news sources’ to avert the potential dystopia that awaits us in a post-truth era of fake news.

results.title: Jordan Paul: one teacher's approach
results.creator_credit: Gary Schlosser, Extension Media Centre and Vaughn Ohern
results.brief_description: Jordan Paul’s approach to the drug problem is to relate to his students, by any means he can, in order to communicate about drug abuse. His approach is non-directive, he has problems to over come as an authority figure, but he promotes the substitution of people as an alternative to drugs. High school students discuss aspects of drug education.

results.title: Jonathan Livingston seagull
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, JLS Partnership and Hall Bartlett
results.brief_description: Richard Bach’s best selling novel about spiritual development and human achievement is brought to life in this rendition, complete with a Neil Diamond soundtrack. The story begins with a flock of seagulls pecking at garbage left by a boat. One of these seagulls - Jonathan (voice supplied by James Franciscus), longs to soar above his current existence, reaching dizzying heights and be the fastest seagull. Thus he leaves the flock to see the world and in search of speed. On reaching aviary heaven he meets Maureen Seagull (voice supplied by Juliet Mills) who introduces Jonathan to new experiences. Jonathan returns to his flock with new found knowledge but the other seagulls are sceptical until he performs a miracle and Jonathan is elevated to a messianic hero. Voices also supplied by Philip Ahn, Richard Crenna, Kelly Harmon and Hal Holbrook.

results.title: Jonas Salk: science of life
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, Peter Poor and CBS Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Dr Jonas Salk, at his Institute for Biological Studies, is seeking ways to fuse the two disciplines of the scientist and humanist. It is vital for scientists and humanists to work together, he claims, ‘to make the decisions and choices that nature has made until now…for the greatest value to human life and society as a whole’.
